creator: Pearce, William, 1848-1930. (author)
Canada. Department of the Interior (author)
description: Pearce, William: 1848-1930. Civil engineer; in charge of land surveys in Manitoba & NWT, 1873-1881; entered Dominion civil service, 1882, and successively inspector of land agencies, superintendent of mines in Manitoba & NWT and chief inspector of surveys; on royal commission to inquire into freight rates in the West, 1894 (Morgan, Canadian men and women of the time, 1912; Robertson, A political manual of the province of Manitoba; Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography).

Métis--Terres
title: Detailed report upon all claims to land and right to participate in the North-West half-breed grant by settlers along the South Saskatchewan and vicinity west of range 26, W. 2nd meridian: Being the settlements commonly known as St. Louis de Langevin, St. Laurent or Batoche, and Duck Lake
